In Buddhism

Tibetan Buddhism (Vajrayana or tantric Buddhism)

Source: Rigpa Shedra: Wiki

skar rtsis (སྐར་རྩིས) in Tibetan refers to the Sanskrit Jyotiṣa (“mathematics and astrology”).—As one of the “Five Minor Sciences” (Tibetan: rig gnas chung lnga) it forms part of the “Ten Sciences” (Tibetan: rig gnas bcu), or fields of knowledge.

context information

Tibetan Buddhism includes schools such as Nyingma, Kadampa, Kagyu and Gelug. Their primary canon of literature is divided in two broad categories: The Kangyur, which consists of Buddha’s words, and the Tengyur, which includes commentaries from various sources. Esotericism and tantra techniques (vajrayāna) are collected indepently.
